ghana_activities.name: Cape Coast Castle
ghana_activities.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and former slave trading post built by the Portuguese in the 15th century. This historic castle offers guided tours through dungeons, courtyards, and the governor's quarters, providing insight into Ghana's colonial history and the transatlantic slave trade.

ghana_activities.name: Kakum National Park Canopy Walkway
ghana_activities.description: Experience the rainforest from above on this thrilling 350-meter canopy walkway suspended 40 meters above the forest floor. The walkway consists of seven bridges connecting tree platforms, offering spectacular views of the tropical forest and wildlife.
ghana_activities.address: Kakum National Park, Central Region, Ghana

ghana_activities.name: Mole National Park
ghana_activities.description: Ghana's largest wildlife park featuring elephants, antelopes, baboons, and over 300 bird species. Take a guided safari drive or walking tour to spot wildlife in their natural habitat. The park also offers accommodation and restaurant facilities.
ghana_activities.address: Mole National Park, Savannah Region, Ghana

ghana_activities.name: Kwame Nkrumah Memorial Park
ghana_activities.description: A memorial dedicated to Ghana's first president and independence leader. The park features a mausoleum, museum, and beautiful gardens. Learn about Ghana's independence movement and Dr. Nkrumah's legacy through exhibits and guided tours.
ghana_activities.address: High Street, Accra, Greater Accra Region, Ghana

ghana_activities.name: Kumasi Central Market (Kejetia)
ghana_activities.description: The largest open-air market in West Africa, offering everything from traditional crafts and textiles to fresh produce and spices. Experience the vibrant atmosphere, bargain with vendors, and purchase authentic Ashanti crafts and kente cloth.

ghana_activities.name: Boti Falls
ghana_activities.description: A stunning twin waterfall located in the Eastern Region. The falls consist of two side-by-side waterfalls that create a beautiful natural spectacle. Visitors can swim in the pool below and enjoy the surrounding forest scenery.

ghana_activities.name: Labadi Beach
ghana_activities.description: One of Accra's most popular beaches, known for its golden sand and vibrant atmosphere. Enjoy swimming, beach volleyball, horseback riding, and local food from beach vendors. The beach comes alive on weekends with music and entertainment.
ghana_activities.address: Labadi, Accra, Greater Accra Region, Ghana

ghana_activities.name: Manhyia Palace Museum
ghana_activities.description: The official residence of the Asantehene (King of Ashanti) and a museum showcasing Ashanti history and culture. View royal artifacts, traditional regalia, and learn about the rich Ashanti kingdom through guided tours and exhibits.
